document.heading: Automatic Substitution of Fiduciaries Amendment Act of 1989

history.narrative: Law 8-10, the “Automatic Substitution of Fiduciaries Amendment Act of 1989,” was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 8-141, which was referred to the Committee on the Judiciary. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on April 4, 1989 and April 18, 1989, respectively. Signed by the Mayor on April 27, 1989, it was assigned Act No. 8-26 and transmitted to both Houses of Congress for its review.
